text: Pacores or Pakores (Greek: ΠΑΚΟΡΗϹ Pakorēs; Kharosthi: 𐨤𐨐𐨂𐨪 , ;Gardner, Percy, The Coins of the Greek and Scythic Kings of Bactria and India in the British Museum, p. 110 Aramaic: pkwry) (100–135 AD) was a king. He ruled in the Indo- Parthian Kingdom in Arachosia from 100–130 AD. He ruled after Ubouzanes.Indo- Greek and Indo-Scythian Coinage - Michael Mitchiner - 1976, Volumes 7 à 9 - Pages 670, 717 and 770 He minted many coins. == References == * Christine Fröhlich. "Indo-Parthian Dynasty." Encyclopædia Iranica. Category:History of Pakistan Category:Pakistani monarchs
title: Pacores
